Package fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2023e3.utils

Interface TimingI

All Superinterfaces:
Serializable
All Known Subinterfaces:
HeaterMeasureI, MeasureI
All Known Implementing Classes:
CompoundMeasure, HeaterCompoundMeasure, HeaterSensorData, HeaterStateMeasure, Measure, SensorData, TimedEntity
public interface TimingI extends Serializable
The interface TimingI defines operation which are used to retrieve timing information associated to some entity, like the time at which some data has been retrieved or computed.

Description

White-box Invariant

 invariant      true        // no more invariant

Black-box Invariant

 invariant      true        // no more invariant

Created on : 2023-11-28

Author:
Jacques Malenfant

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final String
    UNKNOWN_TIMESTAMPER
    value used when an exception is raised in accessing the current host.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Duration
    freshness()
    return the freshness of the timed entity; if only one timing exists, the freshness is the duration between its time stamp and the current instant but when there are many timings, the freshness is the largest between the time stamps and the current time, both to be interpreted under the time reference.
    String
    getTimeReference()
    the time reference to be used to interpret the timing data; two time references are currently defined: if the host hardware clock is directly used, this method returns the same value as getTimestamper() but if an AcceleratedClock is used, the URI of this clock is returned and getTimestamper() returns the identity of the host which hardware clock that supports the AcceleratedClock.
    Instant
    getTimestamp()
    return the Instant at which a timed action has been taken that is interpretable by the context.
    String
    getTimestamper()
    return the identity of the time stamper that can be interpreted in the context; an empty string represents an unknown timing entity.
    Duration
    timeCoherence()
    compute the time coherence among the timings; if only one timing exists, as in scalar measures, the coherence is Duration.ZERO, otherwise it is the largest duration between distinct timings (e.g., for compound measures).

  • Field Details

    • UNKNOWN_TIMESTAMPER

      static final String UNKNOWN_TIMESTAMPER
      value used when an exception is raised in accessing the current host.

  • Method Details

    • getTimestamp

      Instant getTimestamp()
      return the Instant at which a timed action has been taken that is interpretable by the context.

      Contract

       pre    true        // no precondition.
 post   return != null
      Returns:
      the Instant at which a timed action has been taken.

    • getTimestamper

      String getTimestamper()
      return the identity of the time stamper that can be interpreted in the context; an empty string represents an unknown timing entity.

      Contract

       pre    true        // no precondition.
 post   return != null
      Returns:
      the identity of the time stamper that can be recognised by the context.

    • getTimeReference

      String getTimeReference()
      the time reference to be used to interpret the timing data; two time references are currently defined: if the host hardware clock is directly used, this method returns the same value as getTimestamper() but if an AcceleratedClock is used, the URI of this clock is returned and getTimestamper() returns the identity of the host which hardware clock that supports the AcceleratedClock.

      Contract

       pre    true        // no precondition.
 post   return != null && !return.isEmpty()
      Returns:
      the time reference of this timed entity.

    • freshness

      Duration freshness()
      return the freshness of the timed entity; if only one timing exists, the freshness is the duration between its time stamp and the current instant but when there are many timings, the freshness is the largest between the time stamps and the current time, both to be interpreted under the time reference.

      Contract

       pre    true        // no precondition.
 post   return != null
      Returns:
      the freshness of the timed entity.

    • timeCoherence

      Duration timeCoherence()
      compute the time coherence among the timings; if only one timing exists, as in scalar measures, the coherence is Duration.ZERO, otherwise it is the largest duration between distinct timings (e.g., for compound measures).

      Contract

       pre    true        // no precondition.
 post   return != null
      Returns:
      the time coherence among the timings.
